After downloading and installing Kodi, you still need to include add-ons because Kodi does not produce any content by itself. Installing add-ons can be a lot of work, but luckily, things are easier with Kodi builds. 

Browsing through different Kodi builds to find the right one can be a daunting task; for this reason, this article provides a list of the best Kodi builds in the market. The builds are compatible with FireStick, Android phones, Windows, MacBooks, and other devices.

What Is Kodi?

Kodi is basically an open-source content streaming software, and has been around for nearly two decades.

Before being named Kodi, it had two other names: Xbox Media Player and Xbox Media Centre.

This software allows you to access your content from local storage or over the internet using IP addresses. IPs, short for Internet Protocols, are a set of numbers that provide information about your location and the device you’re using to access the internet.

With Kodi, you’ll be able to access an online library of movie streaming channels, shows, sports events, and even more content. Kodi can also be customized with other software, such as addons or Kodi builds to help you access your favorite content.

Most platforms support Kodi, and you can download it online on Google Play, Windows Store, etc. The software does not require much expertise to install and set up, as you will find out later in this article. Kodi also updates its software frequently, meaning some of the builds mentioned here can only work on specific Kodi versions.

Kodi Installation

You can use Kodi on Amazon Firestick, Fire TV Stick, Fire TV Cube, Android Platforms, Windows, and Xbox.

Kodi For Amazon Devices

Kodi is not on the Amazon App store, but you can still load it by following specific steps. Using the downloader app on the Amazon App Store, set up the Firestick for installation by:

  • Enabling ADB Debugging
  • Permitting app installation from unknown sources.
  • Turning off device usage data.
  • Turning off collect app data.

Kodi On Android Platforms

On Android devices, you can download Kodi from the Google Play Store.

Kodi On Windows And Xbox

On Windows and Xbox devices, head over to the Windows Store, type ‘Kodi’ into the search bar, and then install the software from the search results.

Kodi On Mac And Other iOS Devices

On the Download page of Kodi’s website, you will notice a download link for different types of devices. Select MacOs from the provided options, and then click on the provided download button.

Frequently Asked Questions About Kodi Builds

Given that Kodi builds derive from different developers, many Kodi users have a lot of questions concerning these platforms. Here are some of the most common, and their answers. 

Why Do I Need A VPN To Use Kodi Builds?

Some Kodi builds contain pirated content that could land you in legal trouble. Also, government, ISPs, and other third parties such as hackers can easily track your activities online when using Kodi. To keep yourself protected always, you’ll need a VPN.

A VPN masks your IP address, making it difficult for third parties to identify you on the internet. When that happens, it becomes nearly impossible for anyone to tell what you are doing on the internet.

What Is The Difference Between A Kodi Build, Repository and Addon?

A Kodi build is basically a collection of popular pre installed add ons. It also contains numerous Kodi skins.

On the other hand, a Kodi repository, also known as a Repo, is a container where Kodi addons are stored. 

And finally, a Kodi addon is a collection of packages that have certain features and functionalities that are not included with Kodi.

To further understand what a Kodi addon is, think of your computer’s internet browser. If you are using Chrome, for example, you can install extensions from Google, to improve the functionality of your browser.

Browser extensions serve different purposes, such as taking full-page screenshots, blocking ads, translating pages, changing the appearance of the browser, etc. 

Why Should I Enable Unknown Sources Before Installing Any Build For Kodi?

Anything that is not offered in the official Kodi repository is considered to be a third-party. Meaning, it has not been verified by the Kodi team of developers, and may have certain issues, such as copyright infringement. By allowing installation from unknown sources, it is a way of acknowledging that you understand the risks that come with this decision and that you, not Kodi, will be fully liable of any consequence that may arise from the installation. 

Why Should I Reset Kodi To Factory Settings Before Installing Any Build?

Resetting Kodi before installing any build has three main advantages. It frees up memory and space and avoids any compatibility issues that may arise during the installation process.
